section.title: Introduction
section.para: Managing disk images isn't all just file manipulating and storage pool monitoring. After you create a disk image something else is going to use it. That's where performance tuning considerations come into play. This section straddles the line between system administrator and application developer roles. What I mean to say is that application of some techniques in this section may require knowledge which is outside of your domain as a system administrator. To help bridge the knowledge gap I'll include notes on how to identify what you're looking for when tuning the system.
In this section we'll cover the following topics:

listitem.para: Selecting the right disk caching mode
Review cgroups options for balancing resource consumption
